channel.title: CVE Feed for jquery-validation -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for jquery-validation -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-31147|2024-08-03T07:11:39.665Z -- jquery-validation -- jquery-validation
item.description: The jQuery Validation Plugin (jquery-validation) provides drop-in validation for forms. Versions of jquery-validation prior to 1.19.5 are vulnerable to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) when an attacker is able to supply arbitrary input to the url2 method. This is due to an incomplete fix for CVE-2021-43306. Users should upgrade to version 1.19.5 to receive a patch.

item.title: CVE-2021-21252|2024-08-03T18:09:14.663Z -- jquery-validation -- jquery-validation
item.description: The jQuery Validation Plugin provides drop-in validation for your existing forms. It is published as an npm package "jquery-validation". jquery-validation before version 1.19.3 contains one or more regular expressions that are vulnerable to ReDoS (Regular Expression Denial of Service). This is fixed in 1.19.3.
